intro: Hibbertia nutans, commonly known as the drooping hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with long, slender petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia nutans has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It is a perennial shrub that produces fruit in the form of a follicle, which releases seeds when mature.
